meanings.definition: In a manner that deters or discourages.
meanings.sent1: She looked at him deterrently, hoping he would stop bothering her.
meanings.sent2: The security guard patrolled the area deterrently, keeping troublemakers away.
meanings.sent3: The cat deterrently stared at the mouse, making it think twice about coming closer.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds hung deterrently over the picnic, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: His stern warning was delivered deterrently, leaving no room for misinterpretation.

meanings.sent1: The presence of the alarm system was deterrently effective in preventing break-ins.
meanings.sent2: The high fence was deterrently tall, deterring any attempts to climb over.
meanings.sent3: The bright colors on the sign were deterrently cheerful, contrasting the serious message.
meanings.sent4: Her strong stance was deterrently firm, showing she would not back down easily.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog stood deterrently in front of the house, warning strangers to stay away.
